entries.meaning: A robbery or burglary, especially from an institution such as a bank or museum.
(countable, uncountable) A fiction genre in which a heist is central to the plot; a work in such a genre.
examples: The Bank Job is also the first proper Jason Statham movie since his days banging about in Guy Ritchie's early heists.

verbs.description: heist (third-person singular simple present heists, present participle heisting, simple past and past participle heisted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To steal, rob, or hold up (something).
